TO: NAEB Officers and Directors
CO: Harry J* Skornia
Harold Hill
RADI:
PROM: Burton Paulu
SUBJECT: Exchange of. Memoranda between Burton Paulu (March 22,
1957) and Harold Hill (May 2, 1957) relative to the
TIAEB Constitution and By Laws0
Our Columbus agenda was too crowded for us to go into the
contents of either of these two memoranda* Now that I have
had a chance to go over Harold's reply, I find that he and I
are in general agreement on the nonsubstantive items I brought
up© He picked up several mistakes X had made in reading the
Constitution, and suggested several Improvements in the changes
I had outlined*
It seems that at our St* Louis meeting we ought to take
some action on the Constitution, at least in the direction
of ironing out these various discrepancies in phraseology*
In addition to this, we may want to change certain features
of it to expedite our procedures, and also to tighten them up*
I should appreciate the reactions of each of you to my
memorandum and Harold's, and also to this question* Do you
agree with me that v/e should have a Constitution Committee
which will go over the matter of both substantive and word
changes, reporting at one of our business meetings In St* Louis?
If so, who would you recommend as members and particularly as
chairman of such a committee?
This Is a matter which will require a good deal of
careful thought and hard work* The chairmen at least ~~ and
as many other members as possible^hould be fairly well acquainted
with NAEB's internal operations, and should be quite skillful
In writing the kind of language In which Constitutions are
normally phrased, Harold Hill* of course, will be very helpful
In putting this together, but I am sure that he wouldn't want
to assume final responsibility for drafting the exact changes
introduced at the Convention* In any event, we shall ask
Lenny Marks for his assistance* But the main job is ours,
neither his nor Harold's*
?£ay I hear from you on these matters sometime at your
early convenience?
